1: Help,[b] Lord, for the godly man ceases! For the faithful disappear from among the sons of men.
2: They speak idly everyone with his neighbor; With flattering lips and [c]a double heart they speak.
3: May the Lord [d]cut off all flattering lips, And the tongue that speaks [e]proud things,
4: Who have said, “With our tongue we will prevail; Our lips are our own; Who is lord over us?”
5: “For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, Now I will arise,” says the Lord; “I will set him in the safety for which he yearns.”
6: The words of the Lord are pure words, Like silver tried in a furnace of earth, Purified seven times.
7: You shall keep them, O Lord, You shall preserve them from this generation forever.
8: The wicked prowl on every side, When vileness is exalted among the sons of men.
